document_metadata.name: A role for b2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: However, the analysis of the recognition percentage for the same set of data showed that GFP-WT spent significantly more time exploring the novel object compared with APP-WT (p = 0.0032; Fig. 2E), suggesting the presence of a memory deficit in the APP-WT group.

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Hence, the transduction of hAPP-SLA in DG induces recognition memory deficits as supported by NPR and NOR tasks

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Similarly, in the NOR task (15 months p.i.), both the GFP-beta2 and the APP-beta2 displayed higher exploration of the novel object (p < 0.0001 and p = 0.0001, respectively; Fig. 4C and D), with no differences between the 2 groups in the recognition index (p = 0.7; Fig. 4E), meaning that beta2 mice injected with hAPP-SLA did not exhibit the recognition memory deficit observed in APP-WT

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: The locomotor behavior during the NOR habituation phase was measured by the total distance traveled: APP-WT showed higher locomotor activity compared with GFP-WT (p = 0.0027; Fig. 2F)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: We finally measured anxiety levels using the LDB paradigm. No differences were observed between both groups for the index of time spent in the lit compartment (p = 0.7) as well as for the number of transitions (p = 0.2; Fig. 2GeH)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: We did not detect any glia or microglia activation in WT-APP (Fig. 3C and F) compared with WT-GFP (Fig. 3B and E), meaning that the neuroinflammation does not play a role in the memory deficit we observed

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: We did not detect any glia or microglia activation in WT-APP (Fig. 3C and F) compared with WT-GFP (Fig. 3B and E), meaning that the neuroinflammation does not play a role in the memory deficit we observed

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: In addition, viral transduction did not induce any neuroinflammation, as shown in WT noninjected mice (Fig. 3A and D)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: The presence of oligomeric Abeta in APP-WT was confirmed with the antibody VHH 31-1, specific for oligomeric forms of Abeta (Lafaye et al., 2009)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Abeta was mainly found in the polymorphic layer of the DG (Fig. 6, arrows)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Abeta intracellular accumulation in DG polymorphic layer was also confirmed with the rat monoclonal 7H3D6 antibody, also specific for oligomeric Abeta (Kumar et al., 2013) (Fig. 7, arrow)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: In the NPR task (7 months p.i.), the GFP-beta2 spent significantly more time exploring the novel compartment (p = 0.003; Fig. 4A), as well as APP-beta2 (p = 0.017; Fig. 4B).

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Similarly, in the NOR task (15 months p.i.), both the GFP-beta2 and the APP-beta2 displayed higher exploration of the novel object (p < 0.0001 and p = 0.0001, respectively; Fig. 4C and D), with no differences between the 2 groups in the recognition index (p = 0.7; Fig. 4E), meaning that beta2 mice injected with hAPP-SLA did not exhibit the recognition memory deficit observed in APP-WT

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: We then investigated the presence of Abeta aggregates in the hippocampus of APP-beta2 and APP-alpha7. In APP-beta2, a positive staining for Abeta oligomers using the VHH 31-1 antibody was found (Fig. 8, arrows)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: In the NPR task (7 months p.i.), the GFP-beta2 spent significantly more time exploring the novel compartment (p = 0.003; Fig. 4A), as well as APP-beta2 (p = 0.017; Fig. 4B).

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: We observed intracellular Abeta staining in the polymorphic layer of the DG that was absent in GFP-beta2 (Fig. 8)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: The hAPP-SLA transduction in DG did not induce a memory deficit in beta2 KO, meaning that the Abeta/beta2-nAChR interaction is required to drive the memory deficit in this model

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: The hAPP-SLA transduction in DG did not induce a memory deficit in beta2 KO, meaning that the Abeta/beta2-nAChR interaction is required to drive the memory deficit in this model

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: At 7 months p.i., both GFP-alpha7 (p = 0.9; Fig. 5A) and APP-alpha7 groups (p = 0.3; Fig. 5B) displayed a memory deficit in the NPR task.

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: The analysis of the total exploration time during the NOR task showed that GFP-alpha7 spent similar time exploring the familiar and the novel objects (p = 0.76; Fig. 5D), whereas APP-alpha7 spent significantly more time exploring the novel object compared with the familiar one (p = 0.01; Fig. 5E)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: In the NOR task (15 months p.i.) as well, both GFP-alpha7 and APP-alpha7 displayed a cognitive impairment (Fig. 5DeE)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Immunofluorescence performed with VHH 31-1 on brain slices of APP-alpha7 mice also showed intracellular Abeta oligomers in the polymorphic layer (Fig. 8, arrows), whereas GFP-alpha7 mice did not show any Abeta oligomers

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Noninjected mice spent the same amount of time exploring novel and familiar compartments during the test session (p = 0.6; Fig. 5C), confirming the presence of a constitutive recognition memory deficit in age-matched alpha7 KO mice

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Because the alpha7 KO had a memory deficit independent of hAPP-SLA expression, we could not draw any conclusion on the role of alpha7 in the memory deficit observed

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: In the NOR task (15 months p.i.) as well, both GFP-alpha7 and APP-alpha7 displayed a cognitive impairment (Fig. 5DeE)

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: However, we identify a possible role of the alpha7 subunit in the normal aging process that should be further investigated

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Immunofluorescence performed with VHH 31-1 on brain slices of APP-alpha7 mice also showed intracellular Abeta oligomers in the polymorphic layer (Fig. 8, arrows), whereas GFP-alpha7 mice did not show any Abeta oligomers

citation.name: A role for β2* nicotinic receptors in a model of local amyloid pathology induced in dentate gyrus.

links.evidence: Several studies showed that in AD animal models, the appearance of the cognitive deficits precedes plaque deposition (Casas et al., 2004; Gouras et al., 2000; Kumar et al., 2013; Wirths et al., 2004)
